responses.text: Alert/oriented, able to focus and shift attention, comprehends and recalls task directions independently.

responses.text: Requires assistance and some direction in specific situations (for example, on all tasks involving shifting of attention), or consistently requires low stimulus environment due to distractibility.

responses.text: Requires considerable assistance in routine situations.  Is not alert and oriented or is unable to shift attention and recall directions more than half the time.
responses.originalText: 3 - REQUIRES CONSIDERABLE ASSISTANCE IN ROUTINE SITUATIONS. IS NOT ALERT AND ORIENTED OR IS UNABLE TO SHIFT ATTENTION AND RECALL DIRECTIONS MORE THAN HALF THE TIME.

responses.text: Totally dependent due to disturbances such as constant disorientation, coma, persistent vegetative state, or delirium.
responses.originalText: 4 - TOTALLY DEPENDENT DUE TO DISTURBANCES SUCH AS CONSTANT DISORIENTATION, COMA, PERSISTENT VEGETATIVE STATE, OR DELIRIUM.

originalText: (C1310D) ALTERED LEVEL OF CONSCIOUSNESS - DID THE PATIENT HAVE ALTERED LEVEL OF CONSCIOUSNESS, AS INDICATED BY ANY OF THE FOLLOWING CRITERIA? VIGILANT - STARTLED EASILY TO ANY SOUND OR TOUCH; LETHARGIC - REPEATEDLY DOZED OFF WHEN BEING ASKED QUESTIONS, BUT RESPONDED TO VOICE OR TOUCH; STUPOROUS - VERY DIFFICULT TO AROUSE AND KEEP AROUSED FOR THE INTERVIEW; COMATOSE - COULD NOT BE AROUSED TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N

originalText: (PRA) (M2102F) TYPES AND SOURCES OF ASSISTANCE: DETERMINE THE LEVEL OF CAREGIVER ABILITY AND WILLINGNESS TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE FOR SUPERVISION AND SAFETY (FOR EXAMPLE, DUE TO COGNITIVE IMPAIRMENT), IF ASSISTANCE IS NEEDED.  TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N
shortName: Care management, types/sources: supervision and safety
text: Determine the ability and willingness of non-agency caregivers (such as family members, friends, or privately paid caregivers) to provide assistance for supervision and safety (for example, due to cognitive impairment), if assistance is needed. Excludes all care by your agency staff.

responses.text: No assistance needed - patient is independent or does not have needs in this area
responses.originalText: 0 - NO ASSISTANCE NEEDED –PATIENT IS INDEPENDENT OR DOES NOT HAVE NEEDS IN THIS AREA

responses.text: Non-agency caregiver(s) currently provide assistance
responses.originalText: 1 - NON-AGENCY CAREGIVER(S) CURRENTLY PROVIDE ASSISTANCE

responses.text: Non-agency caregiver(s) need training/supportive services to provide assistance
responses.originalText: 2 - NON-AGENCY CAREGIVER(S) NEED TRAINING/ SUPPORTIVE SERVICES TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE

responses.text: Non-agency caregiver(s) are not likely to provide assistance OR it is unclear if they will provide assistance
responses.originalText: 3 - NON-AGENCY CAREGIVER(S) ARE NOT LIKELY TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE OR IT IS UNCLEAR IF THEY WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE

responses.text: Assistance needed, but no non-agency caregiver(s) available
responses.originalText: 4 - ASSISTANCE NEEDED, BUT NO NON-AGENCY CAREGIVER(S) AVAILABLE

originalText: (C1) (QM) (PRA) (M1800) GROOMING: CURRENT ABILITY TO TEND SAFELY TO PERSONAL HYGIENE NEEDS (SPECIFICALLY: WASHING FACE AND HANDS, HAIR CARE, SHAVING OR MAKE UP, TEETH OR DENTURE CARE, OR FINGERNAIL CARE). TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N
text: Grooming: Current ability to tend safely to personal hygiene needs (specifically: washing face and hands, hair care, shaving or make up, teeth or denture care, or fingernail care).

responses.text: Able to groom self unaided, with or without the use of assistive devices or adapted methods.
responses.originalText: 0 - ABLE TO GROOM SELF UNAIDED, WITH OR WITHOUT THE USE OF ASSISTIVE DEVICES OR ADAPTED METHODS

responses.text: Grooming utensils must be placed within reach before able to complete grooming activities.

responses.text: Someone must assist the patient to groom self.
responses.originalText: 2 - SOMEONE MUST ASSIST THE PATIENT TO GROOM SELF

responses.text: Patient depends entirely upon someone else for grooming needs.
responses.originalText: 3 - PATIENT DEPENDS ENTIRELY UPON SOMEONE ELSE FOR GROOMING NEEDS

originalText: (QM) (M1810)  CURRENT ABILITY TO DRESS UPPER BODY SAFELY (WITH OR WITHOUT DRESSING AIDS) INCLUDING UNDERGARMENTS, PULLOVERS, FRONT-OPENING SHIRTS AND BLOUSES, MANAGING ZIPPERS, BUTTONS, AND SNAPS: TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N
text: Current Ability to Dress Upper Body safely (with or without dressing aids) including undergarments, pullovers, front-opening shirts and blouses, managing zippers, buttons, and snaps.

responses.text: Able to get clothes out of closets and drawers, put them on and remove them from the upper body without assistance.
responses.originalText: 0 - ABLE TO GET CLOTHES OUT OF CLOSETS AND DRAWERS, PUT THEM ON AND REMOVE THEM FROM THE UPPER BODY WITHOUT ASSISTANCE

responses.text: Able to dress upper body without assistance if clothing is laid out or handed to the patient.

responses.text: Someone must help the patient put on upper body clothing.
responses.originalText: 2 - SOMEONE MUST HELP THE PATIENT PUT ON UPPER BODY CLOTHING

responses.text: Patient depends entirely upon another person to dress the upper body.
responses.originalText: 3 - PATIENT DEPENDS ENTIRELY UPON ANOTHER PERSON TO DRESS UPPER BODY

originalText: (QM) (M1830) BATHING: CURRENT ABILITY TO WASH ENTIRE BODY SAFELY. EXCLUDES GROOMING (WASHING FACE, WASHING HANDS AND SHAMPOOING HAIR) TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N
text: Bathing: Current ability to wash entire body safely. Excludes grooming (washing face, washing hands, and shampooing hair).

responses.text: Able to bathe self in shower or tub independently, including getting in and out of tub/shower.
responses.originalText: 0 - ABLE TO BATHE SELF IN SHOWER OR TUB INDEPENDENTLY, INCLUDING GETTING IN AND OUT OF TUB/SHOWER.

responses.text: With the use of devices, is able to bathe self in shower or tub independently, including getting in and out of the tub/shower.
responses.originalText: 1 - WITH THE USE OF DEVICES, IS ABLE TO BATHE SELF IN SHOWER OR TUB INDEPENDENTLY, INCLUDING GETTING IN AND OUT OF THE TUB/SHOWER.

responses.text: Able to bathe in shower or tub with the intermittent assistance of another person:  (a) for intermittent supervision or encouragement or reminders, OR (b) to get in and out of the shower or tub, OR (c) for washing difficult to reach areas.
responses.originalText: 2 - ABLE TO BATHE IN SHOWER OR TUB WITH THE INTERMITTENT ASSISTANCE OF ANOTHER PERSON: (A) FOR INTERMITTENT SUPERVISION OR ENCOURAGEMENT OR REMINDERS, OR (B) TO GET IN AND OUT OF THE SHOWER OR TUB, OR (C) FOR WASHING DIFFICULT TO REACH AREAS.

responses.text: Able to participate in bathing self in shower or tub, but requires presence of another person throughout the bath for assistance or supervision.
responses.originalText: 3 - ABLE TO PARTICIPATE IN BATHING SELF IN SHOWER OR TUB, BUT REQUIRES PRESENCE OF ANOTHER PERSON THROUGHOUT THE BATH FOR ASSISTANCE OR SUPERVISION.

responses.text: Unable to use the shower or tub, but able to bathe self independently with or without the user of devices at the sink, in chair, or on commode.
responses.originalText: 4 - UNABLE TO USE THE SHOWER OR TUB, BUT ABLE TO BATHE SELF INDEPENDENTLY, WITH OR WITHOUT THE USE OF DEVICES, AT THE SINK, IN CHAIR, OR ON COMMODE.

responses.text: Unable to use the shower or tub, but able to participate in bathing self in bed, at the sink, in bedside chair, or on commode, with the assistance or supervision of another person.
responses.originalText: 5 - UNABLE TO USE THE SHOWER OR TUB, BUT ABLE TO PARTICIPATE IN BATHING SELF IN BED, AT THE SINK, IN BEDSIDE CHAIR, OR ON COMMODE, WITH THE ASSISTANCE OR SUPERVISION OF ANOTHER PERSON.

responses.text: Unable to participate effectively in bathing and is bathed totally by another person.
responses.originalText: 6 - UNABLE TO PARTICIPATE EFFECTIVELY IN BATHING AND IS BATHED TOTALLY BY ANOTHER PERSON.

originalText: (QM) (M1840) TOILET TRANSFERRING: CURRENT ABILITY TO GET TO AND FROM THE TOILET OR BEDSIDE COMMODE SAFELY AND TRANSFER ON AND OFF TOILET/COMMODE. TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N

IF MANAGING OSTOMY, INCLUDE CLEANING AREA AROUND STOMA, BUT NOT MANAGING EQUIPMENT. TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N

text: Prior Device Use: Indicate devices and aids used by the patient prior to the current illness, exacerbation, or injury.
codingInstructions: Mechanical lift includes any mechanical device or equipment a patient or caregiver requires for lifting or supporting the patient's bodyweight. Examples include, but are not limited to: Stair lift, Hoyer lift, bathtub lift, sit-to-stand lift, stand assist, electric recliner, and full-body style lifts, if required. Walker refers to all types of walkers. Examples include but are not limited to: pick-up walkers, semi-walkers, rolling walkers, and platform walkers.

CODE THE PATIENT'S USUAL PERFORMANCE AT SOC/ROC FOR EACH ACTIVITY USING THE 6-POINT SCALE. IF ACTIVITY WAS NOT ATTEMPTED AT SOC/ROC, CODE THE REASON. text: Primary Diagnosis
codingInstructions: The primary diagnosis is the chief reason the patient is receiving home care and the diagnosis most related to the current home health Plan of Care. Enter the ICD-10-CM code for each condition - no surgical or procedure codes allowed. Codes must be entered at the level of highest specificity and ICD-10-CM coding rules and sequencing requirements must be followed. Note that external cause codes (ICD-10-CM codes beginning with V, W, X, or Y) may not be reported in M1021 (Primary Diagnosis).

responses.text: ICD-10 diagnosis code

text: Primary Diagnosis Symptom Control Rating
codingInstructions: Assessing the degree of symptom control includes but is not limited to review of presenting signs and symptoms, type and number of medications, frequency of treatment readjustments, and frequency of contact with health care providers. Inquire about the degree to which each condition limits daily activities. Assess the patient to determine if symptoms are controlled by current treatments. Clarify which diagnoses/symptoms have been poorly controlled in the recent past. Do not assign a symptom control rating if the diagnosis code is a V, W, X, Y, or Z code.

responses.text: Asymptomatic, no treatment needed at this time
Symptoms well controlled with current therapy
Symptoms controlled with difficulty, affecting daily functioning; patient needs ongoing monitoring
Symptoms poorly controlled: patient needs frequent adjustment in treatment and dose monitoring
Symptoms poorly controlled: history of re-hospitalizations

text: Other Diagnosis 1
codingInstructions: Other diagnoses are comorbid conditions that exist at the time of the assessment that are actively addressed in the patient's Plan of Care - OR that have the potential to affect the patient's responsiveness to treatment and rehabilitative prognosis, even if the condition is not the focus of any home health treatment itself. Enter the ICD-10-CM code for each condition - no surgical or procedure codes allowed. Codes must be entered at the level of highest specificity and ICD-10-CM coding rules and sequencing requirements must be followed. Sequencing of diagnoses should reflect the seriousness of each condition and support the disciplines and services offered.

originalText: (QM) (M2020) MANAGEMENT OF ORAL MEDICATIONS: PATIENT'S CURRENT ABILITY TO PREPARE AND TAKE ALL ORAL MEDICATIONS RELIABLY AND SAFELY, INCLUDING ADMINISTRATION OF THE CORRECT DOSAGE AT THE APPROPRIATE TIMES/INTERVALS. text: Management of Oral Medications: Patient's current ability to prepare and take all oral medications reliably and safely, including administration of the correct dosage at the appropriate times/intervals.
codingInstructions: Excludes injectable and IV medications. (NOTE: This refers to ability, not compliance or willingness.)

responses.text: Able to independently take the correct oral medication(s) and proper dosage(s) at the correct times.

responses.text: Able to take medication(s) at the correct times if:  (a) individual dosages are prepared in advance by another person; OR (b) another person develops a drug diary or chart.
responses.originalText: 1 - ABLE TO TAKE MEDICATION(S) AT THE CORRECT TIMES IF: (A) INDIVIDUAL DOSAGES ARE PREPARED IN ADVANCE BY ANOTHER PERSON; OR (B) ANOTHER PERSON DEVELOPS A DRUG DIARY OR CHART.

responses.text: Unable to take medication unless administered by another person.
